qas.question: What was IBM's operating margin in 2004?
What were the net profit margins of IBM in 2004?
IBM's net profit margins were 16.5% in what year?
IBM's operating margin in 2013 was what?
IBM focusing on markets like business continuity, business intelligence, security, and cloud computing is an example of IBM doing what?
What has happened to DRAM's since they were created?

plausible_answers.text: resulting in a higher quality revenue stream and higher profit margins

qas.question: How did IBM's profitability get better when it got out of the data analytics market?
What was the average operating margin for hard disk drive producers in 2004?
What did the operating margin for hard disk drive producers expand to in 2013?
How much net profit did the average hard disk drive producer make in 2004?

context: IBM has <b5_0>constantly evolved<b5_0/> since its inception. Over the past decade, it has steadily shifted its business mix by <a4_0>exiting commoditizing markets<a4_0/> such as PCs, hard disk drives and DRAMs and focusing on higher-value, more profitable markets such as business intelligence, data analytics, business continuity, security, cloud computing, virtualization and green solutions, <b6_0>resulting in a higher quality revenue stream and higher profit margins<b6_0/>. IBM's operating margin expanded from <a0_0><b7_0>16.8%<b7_0/><a0_0/> in 2004 to <a3_0><b8_0>24.3%<b8_0/><a3_0/> in 2013, and net profit margins expanded from <a1_0><b9_0>9.0%<b9_0/><a1_0/> in 2004 to 16.5% in <a2_0>2013<a2_0/>.
